conclusion: There are four identical blocks: A, B, C, and D.
Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring.
A horizontal force F is applied to block B.
All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration a.
The total mass of the system is 4m.
The total force applied to the system is F.
According to Newton's second law, F = 4ma.
The force F causes all blocks to accelerate with acceleration a.
The spring between blocks B and C exerts an internal force that does not affect the net external force on the system but affects the individual blocks.
Block D is in contact with block C.
For block D to accelerate with the same acceleration a, a static friction force f must act on it.
Since block D has mass m and accelerates with acceleration a, the static friction force f acting on it is given by f = ma.
The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is ma.
